title: SpaceX nears next Starship test flight as Starbase expansion continues
summary: As SpaceX prepares for its next Starship test flight, the company is also working to scale up facilities in Texas to build and launch those vehicles.

title: Boston University wins Collegiate Space Competition
summary: Boston University students proposed pushing defunct satellites from geosynchronous Earth orbit to a graveyard orbit with cubesats.

title: Pentagon working with SpaceX to cut off Russian military’s illicit use of Starlink internet
summary: DoD official John Hill: "SpaceX has been very cooperative with the entire United States government and the government of Ukraine."

title: Global navigation jamming will only get worse. The U.S. needs to move fast
summary: Jamming and spoofing attacks on GPS and other global navigation satellite systems (GNSS) are becoming increasingly common as geopolitical crises escalate, creating major challenges and risks for aviation, shipping and other critical services across the world.

title: Ariane 6 inaugural launch planned for first half of July
summary: The first launch of the Ariane 6 is expected in the first half of July as the vehicle takes shape at its French Guiana launch site.

title: Daily Telescope: Black holes have been merging for a long, long time
China to expand commercial spaceport to support upcoming launch surge
summary: China plans new phases of expansion for its new commercial spaceport to support an expected surge in launch and commercial space activity.

title: U.S. claims recently launched Russian satellite is an ASAT
summary: The U.S. government claims that a recently launched Russian satellite is a counterspace weapon placed in nearly the same orbit as an American reconnaissance satellite.

title: Unlocking Connectivity: The Satellite Industry’s Approach to Achieving Interoperability with Telco
summary: Interstate 95 is America’s busiest highway. Spanning over 1,900 miles between Miami in the south and the Canadian border with Maine in the north, it hosts more than 72,000 vehicles […]

title: BAE Systems wins $450 million contract to build weather satellite instrument
summary: BAE Systems won a $450 contract to develop an ocean-color instrument for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s next geostationary weather constellation.
